jobDescription: MSX International is currently seeking a Data Operations Analyst. This position is responsible for maintaining and improving the quality of the company customer data globally. The successful candidate must have the following skills and experience: Consult with business partners and programming staffs to determine and document data-related requirements and prioritiesManage General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) compliance requests for proper collection and processing of personal information of individuals within the European Union (EU)Independently review and research data requests and data quality issues using appropriate tools and techniquesInterpret results and present to both internal and external teamsTest database changes prior to implementationMonitors data flows for quality assuranceAdditional duties as required for the efficient, smooth and timely flow of work and informationConsultative skills and the ability to communicate with both business and technical managementExpertise within consumer and/or VIN oriented database compilation and database operating systems (DB2, Teradata, Hadoop and SQL Server)Experience with IT system design methodologies and project management principlesAbility to write complex database queries in relational database management systems: Teradata, Hadoop, SQL Server and DB2 using SQL Tools such as SQL Assistant, PL/SQLFive years of hands on experience mining and analyzing very large data stores using SQL requiredFive years of assessing and trouble-shooting data issues on multiple platformsThree to five years presenting clear and concise data analysis to managementThree to five years leading projects that may include multiple team membersEducation Required:BA/BS in computer science, management information systems, statistics, mathematics, marketing research or equivalent technical or semi-technical undergraduate degree18-00640
